How CSS animations were made?

Animation property has a couple of sub-elements:

  • animation-name â€” specifies the keyframe name
  • animation-duration â€” specifies how long the animation should run
  • animation-timing-function â€” this configures the timing of the animation, which animation transitions through keyframes

Animation property can be declared like this:

.mydiv {
  animation-duration: 3s;
  animation-name: my-animation;
  animation-iteration-count: 3;
  animation-direction: alternate;
}

Or shorthand version like this:

/* @keyframes duration | timing-function | delay | name */
animation: 3s linear 1s my-animation;

MDN-CSS Animation

React offers some built-in events for catching animation transitions in our components through the use of SyntheticEvent which is a cross-browser wrapper around the browserâ€™s native event. Meaning, our React components can use native events because of this wrapper, including preventDefault() and stopPropagation() native events.

SyntheticEvent has some support for animation, these are:

  • onAnimationStart â€” This event triggers the moment the animation started
  • onAnimationEnd â€” This event triggers the moment the animation ended
  • onAnimationIteration â€” This event triggers the moment the animation starts looping again
